page.title: 16 Page 15 continued
page.content: The Mayflower park near the water has always been a popular spot for viewing passing ships. The city's colourful past is reflected by the numerous monuments; these include memorials to the sinking of the Titanic, the sailing of the Mayflower and the ruined Holy Rood Church dedicated to merchant seamen. In the area called the New Docks there are six berths, one of which is called the Free Port which is where the old oil tanker, Burmah Endeavour, is kept. There are many sidings leading to each unloading point. The old sheds by them are used only by the birds now. Businesses include a timber yard,the Martini distributors and Rank Hovis with their large grain silos giving a prominent landmark in the area.
